alert.note: Alert for Alger; Luce (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued November 30 at 10:06AM EST until December 01 at 7:00AM EST by NWS Marquette
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 AM EST THURSDAY... * WHAT...Heavy lake effect snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 2 to 7 inches with locally higher amounts. The heaviest snow amounts and poorest visibility will be along the Lake Superior from Grand Marais east to Crisp Point where winds gusting as high as 50 mph could cause localized blizzard conditions at times. The heavier snow bands will stay along the Lake Superior shoreline from Grand Marais east to Crisp Point today and then slowly shift inland this evening. * WHERE...Alger and Luce Counties. * WHEN...From 7 AM Wednesday to 7 AM EST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult, especially near the shoreline. Areas of blowing snow could considerably reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions will impact the evening commute. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency.
